page.title: South Africa national under-20 football team

([[Somholo]], [[Swaziland]]; 11 December 1993){{cite web|title=Under-20 National Team|url=http://www.safa.net/index.php?page=sau20|accessdate=3 January 2011}} | Largest win = | Largest loss = | Olympic apps = | Olympic first = | Olympic best = | Regional name = [[African Youth Championship]] | Regional cup apps = 4 | Regional cup first = [[1997 African Youth Championship|1997]] | Regional cup best = Runners up, [[1997 African Youth Championship|1997]]| }} The South Africa national under-20 football team, is a youth [[association football|football (soccer)]] team, which represents [[South Africa]] and is controlled by the [[South African Football Association]], the governing body for [[football in South Africa]]. The team's main objectives are to qualify and play at the [[African Youth Championship]] and [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. The team has played at four African Youth Championships and two FIFA U-20 World Cups. ==History== The team was started in 1993, when [[South African Football Association|SAFA]] decided to form an under-20 team. The team's greatest achievements to date include a second place finish at the [[1997 African Youth Championship]], hosted in [[Morocco]] and qualifying for the [[1997 FIFA World Youth Championship|1997]] and [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2009 FIFA U-20 World Cups]] in [[Malaysia]] and [[Egypt]]. ==Player eligiblity== Players who are selected, will be 20 or younger in the following World Cup year. With the next [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]] being held in [[Colombia]] in [[2011 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2011]], players need to born on or after 1 January 1991. ==Recent and future matches== Recent results {| class="wikitable" |- !
